page.title: 08The Cinema in Skegness
page.content: {The Tower Cinema}was first built in 1926.It was meant to be a theatre but it was never used as one.It showed black and white films.In 1954 it was re-built after being bombed in World War 2.It can now seat 401 people but it used to seat more. In 1979 the arcade was built and the cinema was moved to the first floor from the ground floor.The cinema shows fictional films,non-fictional films and cartoons.It has 2 projectors and a slide lantern.The projectors take 35 millimetre films.The spools hold 5000 foot of film.The projection speed is 24 frames per second.They get the films from Birmingham.The cinema and arcade is owned by Tower Leisure Limited.It costs Â£1 for children and OAPs and Â£2 for adults.
